ygData.msgSnippet: As an application writer, can I require PUTs to include an ETag? The desire is obviously to enforce the avoidance of last-put-wins problems with ill-behaved

Subject: Required ETag?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=185723118; y=KZHV_TQOFtGG7W9CkkVOpLjWeV2oELM4zYP2NzFSiL8L8MI
X-Yahoo-Profile: foomonga

As an application writer, can I require PUTs to include an ETag?

The desire is obviously to enforce the avoidance of last-put-wins
problems with ill-behaved clients.

I see in the HTTP rfc that clients MAY include the ETAG, but it seems
to me that the server is still within its rights to just deny a client
who exercises this option:

http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.19

Thoughts?

-Miles
